comments.body: In theory this would fail if duplicate items (prob not tested nor likely though)

There were several places like this, all of which were refactored to be functionally equivalent, whenever old code would fail, new code should fail too. I figured that fixing non-trivial duplicate columns issues is better done in separate PRs, this one is already huge.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +486,490 @@            return make_block(values=values,
                              klass=getattr(internals, b['klass']),
                              placement=axes[0].get_indexer(b['items']))

        blocks = [create_block(b) for b in obj['blocks']]
